intro: Annesorhiza abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian anise, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Annesorhiza abyssinica thrives in high-altitude regions and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
